title: Newscast: What No 10 party fallout could mean for the PM
description: Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming and Chris Mason look at the Christmas party row and what it means for the PM.

title: Quiz of the week: Which 'nerdy' hobby is Superman Henry Cavill into?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Dragonflies disappearing as wetlands are lost
description: The loss of marshes, bogs and swamps is driving a global decline in dragonflies, conservation research finds.

title: HMS Richmond returns to UK after seven-month deployment
description: About 800 people were waiting on the jetty in Plymouth to greet their loved ones.

title: Boris Johnson flat row: What do we know about the PM’s finances?
description: The Conservative Party is fined for not reporting contributions to the PM's flat properly.

title: 'I borrowed £50 and we ended up homeless'
description: People could fall into serious debt if they use loan sharks this Christmas, charities warn.

title: Christmas parties row: Three gatherings to be investigated by top civil servant
description: Labour says the PM must resign if he is found to have misled MPs about last year's gatherings.

title: Covid-19: Sajid Javid defends Plan B rule changes amid No 10 party row
description: The health secretary says new rules will buy time against Omicron and denies ministers have lost public trust.

title: 'Pubs may run out of cash as more work from home'
description: We talk to firms which rely on commuters about how the new home-working guidance will affect them.

title: Conservative Party fined over PM's Downing Street flat refurbishment
description: The Electoral Commission fines the party £17,800 for failing to accurately report a donation for the work.

title: Boris and Carrie Johnson announce birth of a girl
description: Boris and Carrie Johnson announce the birth of healthy daughter, their second child since he became prime minister.

title: New Zealand to ban cigarettes for future generations
description: No New Zealander born after 2008 will be able to buy tobacco under proposed new health laws.

title: Covid rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

title: NHS Tracker: How is the NHS in your area coping?
description: Waits for emergency care are worsening - use the BBC lookup to find out how busy your local service is.

title: Covid vaccines: Why is Nigeria unable to use its supply?
description: It's reported that up to one million doses of Covid vaccine in Nigeria have expired and are to be destroyed.

title: Hobbling in field & no-ball drama - Stokes struggles with fitness and form
description: England will assess Ben Stokes' fitness overnight after the all-rounder struggles with form and fitness on day two of first Ashes Test.

title: The Ashes: Travis Head scores century as Australia build lead against England
description: Watch highlights as England's dismal start to the Ashes series is compounded by Travis Head's blistering century on day two of the first Test at the Gabba.

title: Epstein and Maxwell pictured at Queen's residence at Balmoral
description: The image of the couple at Balmoral was shown to a US court on Wednesday.

title: Nightclubs warn Covid passports will have 'devastating' impact
description: Nightclubs say the pre-Christmas period is "absolutely crucial" for the sector.

title: Sam Tompkins: From busking for pocket money to hanging out with Justin Bieber
description: Newsbeat speaks to Sam Tompkins about his journey and hanging out with his "hero" Justin Bieber.

title: Head's 85-ball century puts Australia on top in first Ashes Test - highlights & report
description: England's dismal start to the Ashes series is compounded by Travis Head's blistering century on day two of the first Test at the Gabba.

title: Sports Personality 2021: Can you identify these previous winners?
description: Can you identify these previous Sports Personality of the Year winners in our quiz?

title: Children's mental health: 'The type of self-harm is the worst we have seen'
description: BBC North West Tonight is given exclusive access to the child mental health team in Liverpool.

title: Steven Gerrard: Watch Aston Villa boss' best Premier League goals for Liverpool
description: Relive Steven Gerrard's best Premier League goals for Liverpool before his return to Anfield as Aston Villa manager on Saturday.

title: British waste dumped in Romania
description: A BBC investigation has uncovered British waste being illegally shipped to Romania and dumped.

title: The Ashes: Ollie Robinson takes two wickets in two balls
description: England's Ollie Robinson takes the wickets of David Warner and Cameron Green in consecutive balls on the second day of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba.

title: The Papers: 'One rule for them, new rules for the rest of us'
description: The return of work-from-home request and masks in more places in England leads most of Thursday's papers.

title: Robbie Shakespeare, influential Sly and Robbie bassist, dies aged 68
description: The acclaimed Sly and Robbie bassist is credited with revolutionising the sound of reggae and dancehall.

title: Hardship funding requests rise at English universities
description: Requests for hardship funds doubled in 25% of English universities in the second and third lockdowns.

title: Robin Robin: How Gillian Anderson found her inner feline
description: The actress on the challenges of voicing a menacing cat in the Aardman short Robin Robin.

title: Afghan women: Secret diaries of changing lives
description: Five women's secret diary posts, sent to the BBC, reveal how deeply the Taliban takeover has affected them.

title: Myanmar coup: The women abused and tortured in detention
description: Women held for protesting against a military takeover say they were sexually assaulted and tortured.

title: China's detention camps: Held in chains for using WhatsApp
description: Erbakit Otarbay, an ethnic Kazakh, was imprisoned as part of a mass incarceration programme in China.

title: 'A resignation from the football elite' - reaction to Barcelona's Champions League exit
description: One Spanish newspaper calls it Barcelona's "resignation from the football elite" as they are knocked out of the Champions League before Christmas.

title: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie: ‘I want to say what I think’
description: The Nigerian writer shares her experience of grief and her thoughts on "cancel culture" and trans rights.

title: Growing up in Iran: Every morning we had to chant ‘Death to America’
description: Iranian Rana Rahimpour moved to the UK as a young journalist and is now unable to return home for fear of arrest.

title: Ros Atkins on... the No 10 Christmas party fallout
description: The PM says he’s ‘furious’ about the video and has launched an investigation into whether rules were broken.

title: UK chief vet warns avian flu at phenomenal level in UK
description: The risk to humans is low but diseased birds should not be touched, officials say.

title: Plan B: How will the changes affect the economy?
description: Nightclubs, restaurants and shops could be hit by new Covid curbs, but many firms are well placed to cope.

title: 'I thought I'd forever regret not taking the opportunity'
description: A growing number of people are deciding to switch to a career that has a positive impact.
